subject: Re: [junit] Problems with WL transactions and JUnit
msgSnippet: ... That s what we suspect also. Other than removing the Transaction, do you (or anyone else) have a suggestion for us to correct this? L -- Laurent Duperval
messageBody:
On 19 Oct, Mike Clark wrote:
> Laurent Duperval wrote:
>
>> On 19 Oct, Mike Clark wrote:
>> > Perhaps a look at the TransactionTestCase.setUp() would help, as this
>> > seems to be the differentiator.
>> >
>
> The UserTransaction is enlisting all the EJB resources, but I suspect that
> the transaction isolation levels are causing the finder to only read
> committed data, and the call to setDefault(true) isn't being committed.
>

That's what we suspect also. Other than removing the Transaction, do you (or
anyone else) have a suggestion for us to correct this?

L

--
Laurent Duperval <mailto:lduperval@...>

"L'accent aurait réduit à l'impuissance un chimpanzé en rut."
-Gerard de Villiers
